page.title: 09 PONTESTURY VILLAGE
page.content: The main road runs straight through the middle of Pontesbury. Traffic is very noisy and extremely large, like oil tankers and lorries. It is really a narrow village road and some of the larger traffic has become stuck on the corner! There is a mixture of housing in Pontesbury, both Council and privately owned. School Green, just off the main road, is especially for elderly people. It is owner by the Council who provide a Warden to look after the elderly. The accommodation is chiefly bed-sittingrooms. A number of shops are situated close by. The Post Office and Supermarket are only a few yards away. A few minutes' walk down the road is a chemist,butcher, off-licence, bank and public house. There is also a fine looking church on the outskirts.
